data.title: The Leftovers
data.meta_description: Posts about Comedy written by krkuchta
data.text:
Starring: Crystal Bernard, Patrick Lowe, Kimberly McArthur, Juliette Cummins, Heidi Kozak, Joel Hoffman, Scott Westmoreland, Atanas Ilitch

Directed by Deborah Brock

Format: DVD

Tagline: â€œThrills, Chills, and Guitar Drillsâ€

â€œThe only sane survivor of the first incident, Courtney, dreams of the driller killer returning in the first sequel, Slumber Party Massacre II.She canâ€™t help shake the feeling that she and her friends will be viciously tormented by the killer. Her nightmare becomes reality when the killer returns, reincarnated as an evil rocker with a deadly guitar.â€

The Story:

I snagged Shout Factoryâ€™s collection of all three Slumber Party Massacre films a couple years ago. I watched the first one, which didnâ€™t do too much for me. It was a fun watch but I wasnâ€™t sure if I wanted to watch the second. Until I read the description. Sounds RAD.

My Thoughts:

Juliette Cummins. Lol.

James Cummins. Lol.

Serious flashbacks to the first one. Actually a really well done recap, in case you hadnâ€™t seen the first.

That was a really long â€œsinging in a carâ€ scene.

Girl garage band with a super soft lighting. What the fuck is happening?

You know this girl Sheila is a yuppie bitch when she asks her friend to get her Perrier.

Over the shoulder to HEAD ON SHOT WHAT IS THIS?

Hey, Courtney, remember when your sister got killed? Bummer.

â€œSundayâ€™s my birthday, and I donâ€™t want to go to a mental hospital!â€

This room:

Courtneyâ€™s dreams of a driller killer are so weird. Oh god, now theyâ€™re happening in real life.

Why does the drummer, Sally, always carry pink drumsticks? Just in case?

HAHAHA thatâ€™s not how you eat a corn dog.

A lot of pelvic thrusting.

There are always two guys who show up uninvited to a Slumber Party.

Slow motion pillow and bra fight.

â€œThe more they do it, the louder they get. Practice makes perfect.â€

Subconscious projection has been introduced as a reason Courtney may be fucking nuts.

I hate when people get upset about being splashed at a pool.

TJ is a slimeball though. He just punched a blowup sex doll in front of all his friends.

Courtneyâ€™s losing it. She almost just ate a severed hand sandwich.

A whole, uncooked chicken just attacked Courtney. In her subconscious.

Sally is one of the greatest songwriters of the 80s.

Bloodbath. Courtney is literally in a bath of blood.

She shouldâ€™ve went to a mental hospital for her birthday.

Itâ€™s 45 minutes in and Iâ€™m wondering if anyone will die.

HAHAHAHAHAH PIMPLE POPPING SCENE.

This cop is an asshole.

If I was staying in this house with this crazy girl Courtney, Iâ€™d kick her ass out. Even if it is her birthday.

Drunk jam session.

Holy shit itâ€™s actually happening. Heâ€™s got a drill on his guitar. Heâ€™s killing people. He doesnâ€™t have a name.

That car door was already open, I wouldnâ€™t get in it.

But I guess heâ€™s an imaginative demon thing, he could be anywhere.

TJ, please die.

Courtney broke their only phone. Oh? There was no one else to call besides the police?

WHAT IS THIS DRILLER KILLER MUSICAL NUMBER?

Sheila is being sang to before she dies.

â€œI canâ€™t get noâ€¦.satisfaction.â€ -The Driller Killer

Canâ€™t stop, loving YOU!

The killerâ€™s laugh is horrible.

The Verdict:

I laughed. A lot. This was absolutely ridiculous. So ridiculous I couldnâ€™t get mad at it. Maybe this isnâ€™t a big deal, but the fact that this and the two other Slumber Party Massacres were written and directed by women is interesting to me. Thereâ€™s a documentary on the DVD set about all three movies, Iâ€™ll have to watch that for some insight. But I think about these movies and others directed by women (Humanoids from the Deep, for example), and wonder what differences, if any, they have to the thousands of other horror and slasher movies directed by men. Iâ€™ll have to stew on that, I think.

Starring: Brinke Stevens, Eddie Deezen, Robert Quarry, Jay Richardson, Michael Berryman

Directed by Grant Austin Waldman

Format: DVD

Tagline: â€œSomething wicked this way comesâ€¦â€

â€œAll Hell breaks loose when a young woman decides to rent a creepy old house from a creepy old realtor and the Demons really get cranking!â€

The Story:

So Iâ€™m breaking the rules a bit. I JUST bought this movie from FYE, used, and it looks scratched all to hell. It looks like the demons were really cranking on it. I have a 30-day money back guarantee on it and I really donâ€™t want to be stuck with thisâ€¦uhmâ€¦gem, unless it works. As you can see, it has an all-star cast. Whatâ€™s that thing in the bottom right corner of the DVD case? The DVD menu has an option for â€œWebsite.â€ Listen to the theme song in the trailer. Iâ€™m stoked about this horror comedy.

My Thoughts:

Dead girl boobs one minute and 37 seconds in.

If I see Michael Berryman putting a â€œFor Saleâ€ sign in front of a house, Iâ€™m not buying it.

The moving boxes say â€œBordenâ€ on them. Nice touch, if it was intentional.

The house says it has 12 bedrooms.

Sheâ€™s not even there 2 minutes, and sheâ€™s seeing anacondas in her bedroom. Typical.

Not the Ouija board. Every damn time.

Ghosts and demons always want humans to join them. â€œJoin us, join us.â€ Come on guys, leave her be.

The demon spirits were messing with her milk. Of all things holy.

At the twenty minute mark, there doesnâ€™t seem to be a lot of spoof yetâ€¦

The demon possession has turned Diane (Stevens) into Sandy from Grease. Which is probably where Eddie Deezen comes into play.

Nothing worse than a button fly on a pair of jeans. Though Diane seemed to get them off rather quickly.

The problem with this for me, so far, is that it tries to touch on too many horror movie norms, but not capitalizing on any jokes. The physical â€œcomedyâ€ isnâ€™t comedic and the jokes arenâ€™t punchy.

Demon groping Dianeâ€™s sister Sally in the shower. Yikes.

Ferrets as rats? I guessâ€¦

Jay Richardson as Mike is probably the best role. Comedic relief is not necessarily what it is, but itâ€™s relatively funny.

Soâ€¦who is the teenage exorcist? None of these people look to be teenagers. At all. Unless it hasnâ€™t shown up yet and itâ€™s like a super hero.

The priest turns the demon into a dog, and Sally goes â€œMy sister; a total bitch.â€ Itâ€™s jokes like these, man. Itâ€™s not that funny. Was it funny in â€™91?

Demons, possession, full moon, midnight, spooky house, rats (sort of), creepy basement, ominous phone calls, doors shutting by themselves, and now zombies. This touches on a lot thatâ€™s just not funny.

I just donâ€™t seem to get it. No one is trying to exorcise the demon anymore. They are just all remaining in this house not doing much of anything.

The priest is doing card tricks for the zombies and, wouldnâ€™t you know it, itâ€™s not really that funny.

Do you usually electrocute demons?

The Verdict:

The movie is just a lot of characters standing around waiting for the next opportunity to try and make a horror related joke. Jay Richardsonâ€™s performance was amusing. Eddie Deezen was DESCENT (sort of funny). Speaking of, this:

The back of the DVD says â€œ87 Big Minutes.â€ Ugh, okay. I wish it wasnâ€™t

Starring: Bill Moseley, Tiffany Shepis, Tom Towles, Lindsey Evans, Matt Lero

Directed by Adam Wingard

Format: Special Edition DVD

Tagline: â€œWho do you hate?â€

â€œBill Moseley stars as a smiling maniac named â€˜Mr. Suitcase.â€™ With a briefcase full of razorblades, he crashes a homecoming get-together for Claire (Lindsey Evans) and forces the partygoers to identify people they hate. Soon, a black-hooded supernatural killer is loose killing each person identified by the teens. The terrified friends realize they may also be viciously murdered because Tim (Matt Lero) awkwardly joked that he hated everyone at the party, too! As the corpses pile up and the body parts fly, the kids enlist the help of a crazed chili loving militia man who can give them the weapons they need to stay alive!â€

My Story:

Ah yes, a movie Carly found back in May of 2010 at Strand. Itâ€™s got a couple of horror regulars in it. I always love me some Bill Moseley, you know? Weâ€™ll see how he does in this movie. I just love the fact that the synopsis had to include the fact that the militia man loves chili. I hope that somehow is of importance in this film. Sounds like itâ€™s going to be a pretty interesting flick.

My Thoughts:

A little girl-on-girl to kick things off. Followed by some prick telling one of them to leave.

Oh, sheâ€™s a prostitute, alrightâ€¦

â€œThis is going to be the worst Christmas ever.â€ Thanks, cashier in an elf hat.

Stop fading in and out of him looking around a small motel bathroom.

DEAD HOOKER IN THE BATHROOM. If I had a dime for every time that happenedâ€¦

I donâ€™t know why that opening scene happened. At all.

I do wish my name was Mr. Suitcase though.

OH, that opening scene was later that night!

Yup, that girl is smoking two cigarettes at the same time.

This is the most awkward Christmas get-together.

Slow-motion Bill Moseley is extra creepy.

His teeth are SO white.

HAHAHAHAHAHA Bill Moseley was great.

Okay, the child molester neighbor at the door was stupid. But I guess he needed some distraction.

Pretty good special effects; a solid broken arm.

Oh man whyyyyyy did they have to show a curb stomp?

Tiffany Shepis, there is no reason for you to be cleaning any cafeteria like a ninja.

Jump scare yeahhhhhh. Scared the shit out of me.

Why in the hell did that guy just come in and tell Tiffany Shepis that some drug dealer got killed? She couldnâ€™t have found out another way?

Opera music always plays in funeral homes right?

Forrest Pittsâ€™ voice is bothering me way too much. I almost hope he gets killed off before the others.

Okay, you can puke on your dead motherâ€™s body. That shouldnâ€™t be a problem.

Come on man, why do you have to cut her foot in half?

Tim is so bothersome too. This is bad. Though Devinâ€™s jumpsuit is pretty swell.

â€œWhy did you take that picture (of the drug dealerâ€™s split head)?â€ More importantly, why did you use a Polaroid camera?

The child molester is Robertâ€™s boss, and now he has his ribcage ripped open. Good, great.

The characters really pay NO mind to these grisly murdered people in this town.

I know why this is all awkward. Reasons: Forrest Pitt and Matt Lero.

Iâ€™ve given up on this movie, for real. I donâ€™t even know what to write about anymore.

Claireâ€™s ex-boyfriend Anthony is a nutcase. Almost as nutty as Mr. Suitcase.

OH MY GOD THE KILLER IS DIGGING A KNIFE UNDER ANTHONYâ€™S FINGERNAILS. NO. NO.

AWWWW YEAH, Lilâ€™ Tommy Towles.

I guess the chili is a big part of thisâ€¦so far. I mean, thereâ€™s a 2-3 minute convo about it.

I thought Towles was Timâ€™s uncle. Not his dad?

Claire just gave Mark a wet willyâ€¦why? This is getting real dumb real quick. Much like my grammar just then.

â€œJust help me get the bars off the windows.â€ Umâ€¦that doesnâ€™t just happen.

Oh. my. God. Mark would you stop saying stupid shit to Claire. Please.

Plenty of gore, thatâ€™s a solid.

The Verdict:

Oh man, that was not that good. Itâ€™s unfortunate, the premise sounded somewhat original and interesting, it was just poorly executed. The special effects were fantastic though! And thatâ€™s not quite half the battleâ€¦maybe a quarter or a sixth of the battle. Regardless, brownie points for sure. I just wish it was better. Solid performance by Moseley, Shepis, Towles, and even Evans to some extent. But the other cast members were kind of weak, and the writing wasnâ€™t all there. Anyways, Iâ€™ll leave you with the trailer and, if you come across Home Sick, you can decide for yourself.

Starring: Jason Yachanin, Kate Graham, Allyson Sereboff, Robin L. Watkins, Joshua Olatunde, Caleb Emerson, Rose Ghavami and Khalid Rivera

Directed by Lloyd Kaufman

Format: DVD

â€œWhen a fast food chicken restaurant is built on the site of an ancient Native American burial ground, the displaced spirits unite with the ghosts of exterminated chickens and transform into Indian chicken zombies seeking revenge! Now, itâ€™s up to a dim-witted counter boy, his lesbian ex-girlfriend, and a burqa-wearing fry cook to put an end to the foul-feathered menace once and for all.â€

My Story:

This one is a doozy. Every year at Rock and Shock, Troma has a booth. And for those of you who donâ€™t know what Troma is, I suppose I can give you some insight. Troma is a production and distribution company that prides themselves on the SUPER low-budget films that their names are on. Mostly horror-comedies and complete â€œtrash.â€ And not the bad trash, just sometimes revolting content done in a way thatâ€™s funny or entertaining to watch. It all started with Lloyd Kaufman and The Toxic Avenger in 1984. And it has since grown into this incredible company with a huge cult following.

Anyhow, Troma is loved by many, but also hated for the same reasons. They sometimes release the most absurd films. Like this movie. The film was made in 2006, but wasnâ€™t released on DVD until 2008 (I think). I was given a trailer DVD for Poultrygeist at the 2006 convention and had been anxiously awaiting the DVD release. I couldnâ€™t possibly turn this movie down! I loved Tromaâ€™s Toxic Avenger and Terror Firmer, I couldnâ€™t possible NOT enjoy this.

Low and behold, by the time 2008 came around, it sort of left my mind. I had given up hope on seeing this film. Until one day in FYE, the â€œEggs-clusive 3-Disc Collectorâ€™s Editionâ€ was staring me down from the Used shelf. It was a no-brainer, I had to buy it.

I will admit that I HAVE watched this film. Well, I sort of watched it. I ended up getting sop annoyed with it/preoccupied with other stuff that it was just left on my television and unfinished. Tonight, I attempt to watch the whole thing, thanks to Dan bringing it to my attention once again.

The one thing you must know is thatâ€¦you canâ€™t exactly make fun of a Troma film. It doesnâ€™t work that way. The films are so absurd already that making fun of them for what they are trying to do, doesnâ€™t work. So weâ€™ll see how this commentary goes.

My Thoughts:

Yes there is a Poultrygeist theme song that reminds me of Killer Klowns From Outer Space.

Lloyd Kaufmanâ€™s introduction to Troma movies are ALWAYS so long.

American Chicken Bunker is the coolest fast food restaurant name.

â€œBumping tacosâ€ doesnâ€™t sound like an appropriate name for lesbian sexâ€¦oh Lloyd.

Youâ€™re damn right this is a musical. Oh my god this is insane.

A Sloppy Jose! YES! The best kind of sandwich.

â€œWho put these mysterious, vein-covered, pulsating eggs in this box?â€

Ron Jeremy cameo. Solid.

A morbidly obese man on a toilet. If this is all poop jokes, I may cry.

I canâ€™t believe they Photoshopped chickens into Abu Ghraib.

Second musical number occurs while Arbie (Yachanin) cleans a poop-covered bathroom and Wendy (Graham) is in a protest.

Unnecessary nudity scene.

I feel like there is some sort of social commentary under all the poop and sex jokes.

Director cameo!

â€œIâ€™m Che Guevara, Martin Sheen, and Janeane Garafalo rolled into one fabulous burrito of political activism.â€ Oh really?

Paco would fall into the food processor. Now heâ€™s a Sloppy Jose!

To show off a butt tattoo, would you have to always wear thongs to the beach?

â€œI believe in the supernatural when I see it, talking sandwich.â€

Almost halfway done!

â€œIâ€™m not adverse to hearing whatâ€™s on your dirty, filthy little slut chicken mind.â€ Itâ€™s getting real gross, real quick. I couldnâ€™t have expected any less.

â€œLike Harriet Tubman said, â€˜Let them eat fried chicken.'â€ She didnâ€™t say thatâ€¦did she?

This movie is actually pretty funny. Iâ€™m glad I started giving it another chance.

Whoa, nevermind. Diaper fetish and intense vomiting may have just brought this movie back down a notch.

The General (Watkins) did not just bite the head off a baby chicken zombie.

Human face through a deli slicer, and another head cracked like an egg.

Straight up Birds reference.

YES! The Faintâ€™s â€œDropkick the Punksâ€ is on the soundtrack!

Lloyd Kaufman saves the day, but ruins the moment with â€œBooyah bitches.â€

So.many.chicken.zombies.

HAHAHAHAAHAHA when they turned the Open sign to Closed, the zombies go away. The best.

Just wear the mascot uniform, the zombies donâ€™t know the difference!

Do humans usually grow by drinking a gallon labeled â€œMeat Steroids.â€

Finally another musical number!

The chicken zombie boss spontaneously combusted.

â€œAmerica isnâ€™t ready to accept a gay, Mexican chicken sandwich.â€

There would be a Thriller dance scene. Why must that always happen?

The Verdict:

Wow, wowwwwwwww. That was just craziness. Iâ€™m going through the extras now and the original music for this is so entertaining. â€œAll the zombie chickens from Tromaville. All they want to do is kill, kill, kill.â€ I feel like if I own anything 3-discs or more, I would have to watch at least some of the extras. Music videos, trailers, tons of featurettes. And a lot of actually seems worth watching after a film so â€œepic,â€ so to speak. It wasnâ€™t great, it wasnâ€™t high-budget, but it was entertaining and well-made. I had originally put it on the Shelf of Shame, but I am considering taking it off now that I gave it another shot. I NEVER DO THAT! But seriously, it was really funny. It may not be for a lot of people, but it was well written (the film and songs), and the characters were great. A Troma classic. Iâ€™m actually upset with myself that it was on the Shelf of Shame. But hey, it happens. If you get a chance to see it and can handle some grossness, violence, racism, obscene sex jokes, and chicken zombies, then see it.

Starring: Sam Elliot, Adam Roarke, Joan Van Ark, and Ray Milland

Directed by George McCowan

Format: DVD

Tagline: â€œToday the pondâ€¦tomorrow the world!â€

â€œJason Crocket (Milland) is an aging, physically disabled millionaire who invites his family to his island estate for his birthday party. The old man is more than crotchetyâ€¦heâ€™s crazy! Hating nature, Crockett poisons anything that crawls on his property. But on the night of his shindig, itâ€™s natureâ€™s payback time, as thousands of frogs whip up every bug and slimy thing into a toxic frenzy until the entire environment goes environ-mental.â€œ

My Story:

This is something I wouldnâ€™t usually do. But Iâ€™ll do it and itâ€™ll be done in an hour and a half. Much like 976-EVIL, I saw a Frogs t-shirt on Fright-Rags. I thought the poster was one of the funniest things and I HAD to find the movie. Lucky enough, the library had it. I took it out and hadnâ€™t watched it for two weeks. Much like if I had to buy the movie, but itâ€™d probably be more like two months. This should be good.

My Thoughts:

I would hate to go into this movie NOT knowing it was about killer frogs, you know? I could almost feel the disappointment if the title wasnâ€™t so blatantly obvious.

I go through reptile infested swamps on canoes all the time.

Oh boy, hereâ€™s the environmental aspect. Litter, water pollution, God save us all.

Okay opening credits, I understand that the swamp is made up of reptiles and trash. I get it.

Uh oh, drunk motorboating. Not Wedding Crashers motorboating, but legit motorboat on the open water. Heâ€™s gonna slam that guy in the canoe. Close call.

Why are the French subtitles automatically on?

Sam Elliot was in all denim when his canoe tipped. Thatâ€™s god awful.

Mr. Pickett Smith? Hahahaha, Will Smithâ€™s wife? No, nevermind.

â€œI have suggested pouring oil in the water to kill them off.â€ Is it too soon to make a BP joke?

If Sam Elliot had his mustache in this movie, it would be so much better.

WHO HAS A MOUNTED TIGER HEAD ON THEIR WALL?!?!?!

Sam Elliot watch out for theâ€¦frogs? Does that sound okay?

That property is just a dead animal graveyard. Frogs and snakes and birds andâ€¦PEOPLE?! WTF?

That dead guy is Bub from Day of the Dead.

The father from Creepshowâ€™s â€œFatherâ€™s Dayâ€ should pop in right now.

How did that snake get onto the chandelier?

4th of July! Just in time!

Gah, there are frogs everywhere! I thought there werenâ€™t gonna be frogs in this movie!

American Gladiators jousting on a log with pillows, YES.

â€¦why didnâ€™t they just call an exterminator?

Stop using the same shot of a frog.

The rattlesnake was clearly fangless.

If they put in another lengthy shot of Sam Elliot walking in the woods, Iâ€™ll cry.

I would hate to be an animal wrangler on this film.

WHAT?! HOWâ€™D HE GET SHOT?!?!

Upon further review, this man shot HIMSELF in the leg, and then was attacked by tarantulas and Spanish moss. And one scorpion.

Horrors of Spider Island once again!

There are frogs on the croquet field. Not okay.

The highest-waisted pants ever seen.

This is just the perfect 4th of July movie, Independence Dayâ€™s got NOTHING on Frogs.

In the words of Dan, a friend of mine, â€œThis is Looney Tunes shit.â€ A LIZARD just spilled two glass jars marked â€œPoisonâ€ and they erupted in poisonous gas when they hit the ground and asphyxiated the man in red pants, Kenneth. That was THEN surrounded by Geico geckos and salamanders post-death. And THENNNN Sam Elliot walked into the green house and the poison gas had vanished.

There have been no frog related deaths as of yet. But the 4th of July cake now has frogs on it. Gross.

Iâ€™m pretty certain this lady is gonna get killed by butterflies in a minute.

Woman landed in a puddle, yelled â€œowwwwwâ€ and keeps falling down.

Maybe the frogs are the animals in charge of this war on people. Because frogs havenâ€™t attacked anyone yet.

A rattlesnake bit this woman Iris, and she already turned green. Immediately.

I hope the end credits song is â€œAmos Moses.â€ It would go along with the fact that FROGS HAVE NOT ATTACKED A SINGLE PERSON.

â€œHe got bit by a snake.â€ â€œIs that an accident Grandpa?!â€ No, he picked up the snake and latched it onto his neck. Suicide. Stupid question.

Iâ€™m just waiting for some sea monster to kill someone next.

There is NOT a bird attack. No. No. IS NOTHING SACRED?!

Oh my god, the lizard cut the rope for the boat! Now theyâ€™ll never get off the god forsaken dock.

There is no way she can see from the porch, through the yard and trees and all the way across the pond to know that guy SOMEHOW got dragged underwaterâ€¦BY ONE SNAKE.

OMG BOWSER is in the water!

This film is rated PG, just in case you were wondering.

â€œWatch out for the frogs.â€ THE FROGS HAVENâ€™T DONE ANYTHING!

Really, youâ€™re going to give the youngest kid the shotgun?

Watch out for that one snake, heâ€™ll pull you under the two feet of water youâ€™re standing in Sam Elliot.

Wow Mr. Crockett, you would lift yourself out of your wheelchair, fall on the ground, only to be surrounded by frogs FOR NO REASON.

Zero frog related deaths in that film. Zero.

The Verdict:

Dreadful. Very slow and dragging and, like my last comment, no death by frog. In a film called Frogs that gets compared to The Birds, the film should PROBABLY be about frogs actually attacking people as opposed to influencing other animals to attack for them. But I guess the filmmakers were like, â€œWellâ€¦while frogs may scare some people, the canâ€™t do much harm when theyâ€™re in some Florida swamp. Letâ€™s make them fascist dictators and have them rule over all other swamp creaturesâ€¦and KILL people.â€ Stupid, stupid, stupid idea. This wasnâ€™t a fun bad movie unfortunately. Actually, I take that back. Some of it was pretty funny. But it wouldâ€™ve been funnier if the title and cover werenâ€™t so misleading. The trailer for the film gives a little more info thoughâ€¦so maybe I shouldâ€™ve watched that first.

I like how my last line before I started the movie was â€œthis should be good.â€ Never will I say that again. If this was my movie, it would immediately go on the Self of Shame. No doubt about it.

Starring: Bryan Callen, Noureen DeWulf, Mircea Monroe, Stephen Kramer Glickman, Steven Sims

Directed by Chris Moss

Format: .mkv file.

My Story:

When the weekends are nice, my family all gets together and we watch movies. Our family friend has a lot of movies converted onto his computer, so we just hook it up to the TV and there she blows. Tonight kicked off a marathon weekend of movies in honor of Memorial Day. We watched three-quarters of When In Rome, which crapped out before the ending. Then we watched Youth In Revolt, which was better than I expected. And after almost everyone went to bed, four of us were left awake and we chose to watch this spoof movie. I do not have this on DVD, this is not something I own. But with a title like this, Iâ€™m not sure if I can pass it up.

My Thoughts:

â€œMorning Woodâ€ is seriously the title song? Oh my.

The people impersonating Jonah Hill and Seth Rogan are greatâ€¦but this movie will be horrible.

Sarah Silverman impersonator isnâ€™t too bad either.

Reminiscent of Mafia!

After watching Superbad earlier today, I donâ€™t know if this is funny or painful to watch.

â€œYou look like Hannibal Nipples.â€ Thatâ€™s not even a good joke.

Twilight spoof! YES! I hope thatâ€™s not the only one.

Awwww yeah, Twilight came back! Wait, that wasnâ€™t funny at allâ€¦

That manâ€™s head is SO small.

They arenâ€™t seriously spoofing There Will Be Blood. I really should start questioning why they are spoofing most of these anyways.

Like, the Verizon Wireless man came out of a freezer for god sakeâ€™s. If he doesnâ€™t show up again in the movie, I may cry.

Censorship bars!

HA! Verizon Wireless guy is back.

I just sighed so loudly at this movie. Itâ€™s all hitting me.

I never saw Forgetting Sarah Marshall, Iâ€™m not sure if Iâ€™ll understand some of this.

â€œToastedâ€ is not a word I hear often in regards to â€œdrunk.â€

WHY IS STAR WARS BEING SPOOFED?!

Bryan Callenâ€¦you arenâ€™t funny.

Why do I put myself through such atrocities?

Oh, nice AfterEffectsâ€¦not.

The Verdict:

If I owned this movie, I donâ€™t even know if I would put it on the Shelf of Shame. Iâ€™d be so upset about it, I mightâ€™ve just gotten rid of it. Awful, I shouted â€œWhat?!â€ and sighed many times through the movie. I have never seen Date Movie or Disaster Movie or really any other spoofs before. Well, Iâ€™ve seen Mafia! and some of the Scary Movie series, but nothing THIS bad. It almost doesnâ€™t even make sense to spoof so many movies by mainly one person, that being Judd Apatow. Itâ€™s like, they had to throw in a Twilight spoof in order for people to be like â€œAt least they made fun of something that isnâ€™t good.â€ Thereâ€™s something graceful about Apatowâ€™s sense of humor. And when you try to mimic it, even in order to spoof it, it doesnâ€™t match. The few things I liked, which I had mentioned before, were the initial impersonations of certain actors (whoâ€™s characters names were the impersonated actorâ€™s first name). But these performances didnâ€™t carry well through the movie, because there were so many skips and jumps away from the story. Iâ€™m not going to say that it wasnâ€™t funny, because there were funny parts. Itâ€™s hard for there to be a spoof movie with absolutely NOTHING funny about it. I just canâ€™t remember what they were because I was fuming more than laughing. Itâ€™s like this one time, these brothers told me how funny Superhero Movie was. I didnâ€™t believe a word of that. But for whatever reason, I had some faith for this movie. The most false hope I have ever experienced. If you plan on watching this, please PLEASE reconsider. You are just going to get yourself angry. Or if you choose to watch any of it, the first twenty minutes are your best bet. Iâ€™ve watched about five movies today, and to end with this movie at 1 AM will hopefully work me up so much that Iâ€™ll just pass out.

Whew, well, that was a bit rough. Iâ€™ve just never experienced a spoof movie so bad before. Props to casting for the most part though, to leave on a good note. Thatâ€™s the only good note, however.

Starring: Donald Glover, D.C. Pierson and Dominic Dierkes

Directed by Dan Eckman

Format: DVD

Tagline: â€œSaving the world from sex, drugs, and swear words.â€

â€œThey were kid detectives. Now theyâ€™re eighteen and still solving child crimes. But when the Mystery Team is challenged to solve a murder, theyâ€™re pulled into a dangerous world of sex, drugs, and swear words. From DERRICK Comedy, the Internet comedy sensation whose short films have been viewed over 150 million times online, comes this strangely hilarious, completely unique film thatâ€™s been called â€˜Encyclopedia Brown meets Napoleon Dynamite with a pinch of Ace Ventura.'â€

My Story:

Well, Mystery Team isnâ€™t a movie that has been sitting on my shelf long. I only bought it on Saturday. I have been so eager to watch it though, that it jumped up quite high on my list. I absolutely love DERRICK Comedy, the comedy troupe that wrote this movie. I think all their stuff is hilarious. And I have absolutely no doubts about this movie being funny going into it. Three friends and I sit down to see what Mystery Team has in store for us.

My Thoughts:

Oh my god, this is ten minutes in and I am laughing out loud a lot.

Now they have to solve a MURDER!

The Mystery Team keeps saying â€œneatoâ€ and I want to start saying it.

Bobby Moynihan as the grocery store clerk is fantastic.

The Mystery Team goes to a gentlemanâ€™s club all dressed similarly to the Monopoly man, thatâ€™s priceless.

My friend Jimmy is literally crying laughing while watching this.

â€œFlipped faster than a Sunday morning pancake.â€ Why yes it did.

The â€œwhodunitâ€ aspect of this story is really good.

The coke dealer in this movie is sketchballs. But, I would assume that a lot of coke dealers are sketchballs.

The comedy is classic. So is the mystery.

I love the term â€œliving the dream.â€

Oh man, the Mystery Team is fighting! ğŸ˜¦

I guess the underlying stories are very generic, but the chain of events is incredible.

My friend Albert is now laughing hysterically as well.

Showdown in the lumber yard!

SEQUEL SEQUEL SEQUEL.

The Verdict:

As I said before, I feel that it is quite hard to write about comedy. As you can see in â€œmy thoughts,â€ there werenâ€™t too many. I havenâ€™t figured out the best way to write about comedy yet. But I didnâ€™t want to keep this movie from you all because it was fantastic. It was very well written and very funny. Like I had mentioned, it took basic/classic aspects of comedy and mystery and put them into a contemporary story. With very crude sexual humor, but funny nonetheless. One thing that did sort of bother me in the first half of the movie were the same static shots of the Mystery Team. All three of them would be lined up in front of the camera in a superhero-esque pose as they talk about the mystery. This couldâ€™ve been part of the comedy that I mistook for repetitive shots though, so it really wasnâ€™t a huge problem. It was a movie that I thought was written very well and kept my attention just as well as any of DERRICK Comedyâ€™s 3-minute shorts. Very generic comedy and mystery guidelines helped mold a hilarious film that I highly recommend to anyone looking for a break from the same-old.

Starring: David Naughton, Brian Oâ€™Halloran, Gerry Bednob, Ellen Sandweiss, Ken Foree, Gunnar Hansen

Directed by Stevan Mena

Format:Widescreen DVD

Tagline: â€œSo funnyâ€¦it hurts!â€

â€œWhat has the world come to when the director of Sasquatch at the Mall canâ€™t get a gig? Thatâ€™s what horror auteur Harry Penderecki (David Naughton) is wondering. Once considered a horror legend, with a string of hits like Bowel Movement, People Pesticide and Iâ€™ll Take the Ring Back and the Finger Too, he now finds himself on the outside looking in at Hollywood. Determined to make his comeback, Penderecki returns to direct what he believes will be his ultimate masterpiece, Brutal Massacre. Follow along with this documentary crew to discover whether Harry will reassert his genius, or remain a relic of the â€™80s.â€

My Story:

I first heard about this film through Fangoria magazine. I donâ€™t know if there was an article or an advertisement or what, but I had somehow known about it. Then a year later I went to Rock and Shock, a horror convention in Worcester, MA. There, I had met and interviewed Brian Oâ€™Halloran for my high school. He had mention that he had done a film called Brutal Massacre and the film was brought back to my attention. The next year, I went to the same convention and got an autograph from Gunnar Hansen, also an actor in this film. I felt as if I had put off purchasing the film enough and finally bought it. But of course, as you know from this blog, purchasing and viewing are not the same thing. It only took me a few months to watch it here and now; it couldâ€™ve been worse.

My Thoughts:

I have a feeling this film is going to touch my soul. Especially when the mockumentary starts out at Fangoriaâ€™s Weekend of Horrors.

This already reminds me of The Deal. The fact that David Naughton doesnâ€™t want to show investors his script is quite amusing.

â€œYou canâ€™t sell these fright films if thereâ€™s no nakedness.â€ Hahahaha.

Another film about Hollywood on Hollywood, except in the realm of B-movies.

So far itâ€™s kind of amusing, just the satire of exploitation and B-rate horror movies. Itâ€™s something I can appreciate.

A slasher movie for kids!

I canâ€™t watch Brian Oâ€™Halloran do anything without thinking of Dante from Clerks.

I make the misconception that Scorsese directed Apocalypse Now just like they did in this movie. Iâ€™m so ashamed.

Gunnar Hansen is great.

Silent prayer to the film gods? Understandable I guess.

I feel like Troma shouldâ€™ve had something to do with the film they are making in the movie. Terror Firmer anyone?

Ken Foree is great as well, especially when you think of him as Mr. Rockmore.

If I had to compare once again to The Deal, which I know I shouldnâ€™t, Brutal Massacre is easier to grasp the satire of filmmaking. But then I guess The Deal was really about Hollywood and business and not the production process as much. That and the romantic story.

Man, I wish my town still had a Movie Gallery like the one in this film. They even have the Dot Sale!

Where did Hansenâ€™s character go?

The film within the film could not have been a union shoot.

Do you know how hard it is to write about a movie thatâ€™s about the filming of a movie? I shouldâ€™ve thought about this before hand. This isnâ€™t going to be the best write up.

Brian Oâ€™Halloran is so Clerks., I canâ€™t even take it.

Oh man, I wasnâ€™t going to trust any film labs if the lab in this movie destroyed their film. I know that game.

The Verdict:

I had an appreciation for it because Iâ€™m a horror fan, but I donâ€™t know if I totally see the same appeal happening for others. If youâ€™re into mockumentary, itâ€™s done pretty well. Though at some parts, that documentary feel was unnaturally broken. Itâ€™s a fun movie nonetheless. There isnâ€™t anything fantastic about this movie, except maybe Gunnar Hansenâ€™s excessive use of â€œfuckâ€ and itâ€™s various forms. And in my mind, I didnâ€™t feel as if it was a totally developed story or idea. But thatâ€™s not really my place to be. Overall, I was amused. But I was the target audience, so the film accomplished that much. This review is a bit shorter than usual, but I found it tough to critique this. I liked it well enough, but it couldâ€™ve been better.

Starring: William H. Macy and Meg Ryan

Directed by Steven Schachter

Format: Widescreen DVD

Taglines: â€œRoll the cameras.â€

â€œTwo people have never been so wrong for each other.â€

â€œCharlie Berns (William H. Macy) is a veteran Hollywood movie producer who has given up on his career and life. That is until his idealistic screenwriter nephew (Jason Ritter) comes bearing the script of a lifetime and Charlie decides to give his career one final shot. The only thing standing in his way is Diedre Hearn (Meg Ryan), a sharp-witted studio executive brought in to keep Charlie in line. But when their A-list action star (LL Cool J) gets kidnapped and the studio shuts down their movie, Charlie and Diedre reluctantly team up to pull off one of the biggest hustles in Hollywood history and, amidst the chaos, suprisingly discover they are falling for each other.â€

My Story:

My mom sent me this movie while I was up at college. She told me that this movie was hysterical and that I HAD to watch it. Now, my mom and I probably agree about 75% of the time on movies, but I am sometimes a little weary of her claims. One example that sticks out was when she told me how good the sexual tension of Twilight was. But you know, stuff like this only makes up 25%. I like William H. Macy enough and comedies have a little more leeway in my mind, so I might as well give it a shot now to take a break from the long list of horror films I have yet to watch.

My Thoughts:

If itâ€™s any consolation, some trailers before the film looked like tolerable movies. Except for JVCD.

Mr. Macy is looking kinda down in the dumps. That and heâ€™s trying to kill himselfâ€¦

HA! The thought of LL Cool J in a movie stopped William Macy from killing himself. Probably wouldâ€™ve stopped me as well.

I realized that I refer to the film characters by the actorâ€™s names, but I feel as if it is a lot more amusing that way. Iâ€™ll keep it.

Well, that was really fast. Macy stopped being suicidal because Jason Ritter gave him a script where he cast LL Cool J as an 1800s English Prime Minister? Not even 10 minutes in to the film.

There is quite a large tree in Macyâ€™s empty pool. Oh, they worked that into the script, thanks Meg Ryan!

â€œYouâ€™re not nudgeable.â€ Hmmmm, I like that fake word.

â€œWeâ€™re in the entertainment business, Iâ€™m entertaining myself. What else are we gonna do? Get all depressed and suck on the tailpipe of our car?â€ A man of great wisdom.

Macyâ€™s car is started very much like my own car: with a pull string.

Nice little social message about South Africa thrown in there.

I have a feeling this film is all going to be the same. Meg Ryan will do something witty, then William Macy will be a jerk, back and forth with the same music going on.

They keep talking about selling a film studio to the Canadians. Does this happen so often?

LL Cool J has a hoped up, newly converted Jewish actor. The best.

Film crew yamakas!

I feel like the film this movie is about is like Kung Pow: Enter the Fist. Except for a Black, Jewish, action star.

â€œWe could be doing some significant shit here. A real mitzvah.â€ I feel like I canâ€™t really mock a comedy like this.

Meg Ryanâ€™s sunglasses are so square and bothersome.

I love when a goodbye moment in a film is literally called a â€œgoodbye momentâ€ by the characters.

I feel as if Iâ€™ve run out of things to say about this film. It has become a bit absurd. And not in an â€œHAHAHA this is ridiculous! I love it!â€ But more like an, â€œOh my, this is strange and I canâ€™t follow this.â€

I want to be on the set of a film when itâ€™s all a wrap. Thatâ€™d be so cool.

The Verdict:

The pacing was quite fast. I spent more time wondering what was going on in The Deal than I was comfortable with. And I think with comedy, you shouldnâ€™t be so disoriented when it comes to the story. I do like movies about movies though, so that was a plus. It had hints of Bowfinger in it I feel, and I like to be able to see how Hollywood depicts Hollywood. The performances by Macy and Ryan were pretty plain, but they fit perfectly into these characters. And the supporting cast all played their characters well. The complexity of the relationship between characters is quite nice, and the dialogue was written well. The wittiness of Macy and Ryanâ€™s characters was well done, but unfortunately that only did so much to try and override the other faults of the film. It was a cute movie. Yes, I said it was a cute movie because it is! Itâ€™s a romantic comedy with a literal Hollywood setting, and I thought the idea was great. The execution, however, couldâ€™ve been better. Props to mom for picking out an interesting film.
